projects: [{"title":"Portfolio Risk Management and Asset pricing Model, Prof. Abhijeet Kumar, VGSOM, IIT Kharagpur ","start_date":"Aug 2020","end_date":"Present","description":"• Developing strategic and tactical risk asset allocation of securities analyzing the desired overall risk and return profile of a portfolio • Assessing systematic & unsystematic risk, computed industry & firm beta, CAPM, WACC, risk-free rate, market premium & cost of equity• Incorporating additional risk factors like value, liquidity, market and investors sentiment to deploy a multi-factor asset pricing model "},{"title":"Predicting Credit Card Approvals","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Jan 2020","description":"• Automated the time-consuming process of approval of credit card applications using feature selection & Machine Learning models • Based on an individual's credit report, achieved a model accuracy of 85.21% obtained by using the Logistic Regression method"},{"title":"Risk and Returns: The Sharpe Ratio ","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Jan 2020","description":"• Used Machine Learning and Applied Finance to visualize the profitability & risks involved in two different investments• Calculated the relative performance of stocks of Amazon and Facebook vs. the S&P 500 benchmark using the Sharpe ratios"},{"title":"Which Debts Are Worth the Bank's Effort?","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Jan 2020","description":"• Used Regression discontinuity to analyze whether the additional cost of assigning customers to higher recovery strategy is worthy• Analyzed the problem using Exploratory graphical & statistical Analysis of the recovery amounts collected by the banks"}]
